metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15710 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Potential double free in Bluez 5 module of PulseAudio could allow a local attacker to leak memory or crash the program. The modargs variable may be freed twice in the fail condition in src/modules/bluetooth/module-bluez5-device.c and src/modules/bluetooth/module-bluez5-device.c. Fixed in 1:8.0-0ubuntu3.14.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15710` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpulse-mainloop-glib0 - 1:11.1-1ubuntu7
libpulse0 - 1:11.1-1ubuntu7
libpulsedsp - 1:11.1-1ubuntu7
pulseaudio - 1:11.1-1ubuntu7
pulseaudio-equalizer - 1:11.1-1ubuntu7
pulseaudio-module-bluetooth - 1:11.1-1ubuntu7
pulseaudio-module-gsettings - 1:11.1-1ubuntu7
pulseaudio-module-jack - 1:11.1-1ubuntu7
pulseaudio-module-lirc - 1:11.1-1ubuntu7
pulseaudio-module-raop - 1:11.1-1ubuntu7
pulseaudio-module-zeroconf - 1:11.1-1ubuntu7
pulseaudio-utils - 1:11.1-1ubuntu7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pulseaudio package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:11.1-1ubuntu7').
